Intro.title: What the hack is about.js?
Intro.subtitle: Tech blog about:
Intro.introduction: ðŸ‘‹ My name is Greg and I am here to help you to keep up with the fresh news from JS land.

AboutAuthor.title: Who am I?
AboutAuthor.bio: I love creating new things by coding. I have always liked 'front side' of the cyber world. I have been coding since march of 2020. Before, I've always been curious about how user interfaces work behind the scenes and how I can create them from a blank page in the code editor. I'm fascinated in React, before I met this library I have been coding in vanilla JS. When I started learning React I felt tons of possibilities. I'm a big fan of Next.js with React Server Components. I like taking on difficult programming challenges.

Separator.content: Here is what you will find on this blog

frontend.title: Frontend
frontend.content: Fresh new about frameworks tooling. We all know that a new library pops out every day. If you're looking for news about React, Next.js, Tailwind etc. This blog will keep you informed about React, Next.js, Tailwind, and more...

backend.title: Backend
backend.content: JavaScript has long been more than just a frontend-specific programming language. With Node.js and other backend tools on the belt, you can build modern, robust server-side applications. I'll show you how to do this in practice.

webDevFullstack.title: Web dev Fullstack
webDevFullstack.content: Putting things together is both satisfying and exciting. You can do this entirely within the JavaScript ecosystem. You can use full-stack meta-frameworks or create the backend and frontend separately. I'd like to show you my approach and how I take advantage of these possibilities.
